instruction: In a bowl, add yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, fennel powder, dry ginger powder, and salt.
title: Prepare the Mutton Marinade

transcript_segments.text: Hello everyone, welcome back to our channel Kashmir Food Fusion. Click the subscribe button and press the bell icon to stay updated.
Today we'll show you how to make mutton biryani at home. This biryani tastes like restaurant-style, and you can see the vibrant colors in it. This recipe turns out very tasty.
If you're interested, I'll leave the link in the description box for where you can buy the ingredients. Sela rice is mostly used for biryani and pulao.
We’ve taken one kilogram of mutton with bones. Then we have taken five large onions, finely chopped. We've used mustard oil, crushed garlic...
Then we have green chilies, black pepper, red chili powder, and salt.
Ginger-garlic paste, or you can use only garlic. Cumin seeds, cinnamon sticks, and nutmeg. Nutmeg is essential for biryani. I’ll leave a link below.
Mace is also essential for biryani. I’ll link it below. We’re also using kewra water. All of these are used in biryani: turmeric, black cardamom...
Coriander powder, and fennel powder. We’ve used oil, but you can use ghee. Then bay leaves and saffron. First, we’ll heat mustard oil in a pan until it’s hot and smoking.
Keep some oil aside for later. We've fried the onions. In a mixer grinder, add 1 tsp cumin seeds, 2 bay leaves, 2 black cardamoms...
1 cinnamon stick, 1 nutmeg, 2 pieces of mace. Make a fine powder—this is the biryani masala we'll use for cooking.

instruction: Add the cleaned mutton to the marinade. Mix thoroughly until the mutton is evenly coated. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight for best flavor.
title: Marinate the Mutton

transcript_segments.text: Now let’s marinate the mutton. Place the washed meat in a large bowl. Add 1 tsp turmeric...
1 tbsp red chili powder, salt to taste, 2 tbsp of the biryani masala we just made...

instruction: Rinse the basmati rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for 30 minutes. Drain before cooking.
title: Rinse and Soak the Rice

transcript_segments.text: 1 tbsp red chili powder, salt to taste, 2 tbsp of the biryani masala we just made...
Add 250 grams of thick curd (whisk it before adding). Then 3 tbsp finely chopped coriander, and mint...

instruction: Thinly slice the onions and set aside for frying.
title: Slice the Onions

transcript_segments.text: Mix it well. Add one cup of the fried onions we prepared earlier. Crush them and mix into the marinade.

instruction: Heat oil and half of the ghee in a large pan. Add sliced onions and fry on medium heat until golden brown and caramelized. Remove half and keep aside for layering later.
title: Fry the Onions

transcript_segments.text: Mix it well. Add one cup of the fried onions we prepared earlier. Crush them and mix into the marinade.

instruction: In the same pan with remaining onions, add green cardamoms, black cardamoms, cloves, cinnamon, bay leaf, and star anise. Sauté for 30 seconds until fragrant.
title: Temper Whole Spices

transcript_segments.text: Mix it well. Add one cup of the fried onions we prepared earlier. Crush them and mix into the marinade.

instruction: Add the marinated mutton to the pan. Cook on medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the meat is tender and oil starts to separate from the masala.
title: Cook the Mutton

transcript_segments.text: Cover and let it marinate for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, we’ll prepare the rice. In a pot of water, add 15 black peppercorns, 7–8 cloves, 1 tbsp of the biryani masala...

instruction: In a separate large pot, bring water to a boil and add salt to taste.
title: Boil Water for Rice

transcript_segments.text: Boil the water with all these spices.

instruction: Add the soaked rice to the boiling water. Cook until the grains are 70% done—firm but not fully cooked. Drain the rice and set aside.
title: Parboil the Rice

transcript_segments.text: Once it starts boiling, add the washed sela rice. We didn’t soak the rice beforehand as it cooks quickly when added to boiling water.

instruction: Warm the milk slightly. Add saffron strands to the milk and let it infuse for at least 10 minutes.
title: Soak Saffron in Milk

transcript_segments.text: Once it starts boiling, add the washed sela rice. We didn’t soak the rice beforehand as it cooks quickly when added to boiling water.

instruction: Chop fresh coriander and mint leaves. Keep rose water, kewra water, raisins, cashews, and fried onions ready.
title: Prepare for Layering

transcript_segments.text: Drain the rice and spread it out on a tray or strainer to cool. You can remove any visible whole spices.
Put the marinated meat into a pressure cooker and cook it 90% through. Add a little water, not too much. Don’t fully cook it, only 90%, as this is not raw meat-style biryani.
After 2–3 whistles, it should be ready. Cooking time depends on the quality of meat. Now in a pan, we’ll start layering.

instruction: In a heavy-bottomed pot, spread half of the cooked mutton evenly at the bottom.
title: First Layer of Mutton

transcript_segments.text: First, a layer of cooked mutton at the bottom. Then spread a layer of rice evenly on top.

instruction: Add a layer of half the rice over the mutton. Sprinkle half of the fried onions, raisins, cashews, saffron milk, rose water, kewra water (optional), and herbs.
title: First Layer of Rice and Garnishes

transcript_segments.text: First, a layer of cooked mutton at the bottom. Then spread a layer of rice evenly on top.

instruction: Spread the remaining mutton on top of the rice layer.
title: Second Layer of Mutton

transcript_segments.text: First, a layer of cooked mutton at the bottom. Then spread a layer of rice evenly on top.

instruction: Add the remaining rice and repeat the garnishing with leftover fried onions, raisins, cashews, saffron milk, rose water, and herbs.
title: Second Layer of Rice and Garnishes

transcript_segments.text: First, a layer of cooked mutton at the bottom. Then spread a layer of rice evenly on top.
Pour some of the curry over the rice so the color and flavor spread well. Then another layer of rice goes on top.
Drizzle milk in some places for color. You can also use food coloring optionally in a few spots.

instruction: Drizzle remaining ghee on top. Seal the pot tightly with dough or foil and place a lid over it.
title: Add Ghee and Seal Pot

transcript_segments.text: Now we’ll put it on dum (steam cook). You can seal with a cloth or dough. First cook on high flame for 3 minutes, then lower the heat.

instruction: Place the sealed pot over a low flame or on a heavy skillet (tava) to avoid direct heat. Let it cook for 20–25 minutes, allowing flavors to meld.
title: Dum Cooking (Steam Method)

transcript_segments.text: Now we’ll put it on dum (steam cook). You can seal with a cloth or dough. First cook on high flame for 3 minutes, then lower the heat.

instruction: Turn off the heat and let the biryani rest for 10 minutes. Gently mix before serving to retain the long grains. Serve hot with raita or Kashmiri chutney.
title: Rest and Serve

transcript_segments.text: Now we’ll put it on dum (steam cook). You can seal with a cloth or dough. First cook on high flame for 3 minutes, then lower the heat.
You can see the rice grains are fluffy, not broken, and not sticking together. The color looks great. The meat is soft and well-cooked.
Let me show you how to garnish it. You can use a slicer to cut onions into rings. You can use a knife, but the slicer gives better thin rings.
You can garnish it however you like.
